page.title: 04THE OLD CHURCH OF KINNEFF
page.content: The{original church}was opened in 1242,and was rebuilt in 1738 on the same foundations. The church as it stands today was rebuilt in 1876. Within the last few years a {Preservation Trust}has been formed to look after the building. The old church played a very important part in stopping the{Scottish Crown Jewels falling into the hands of Oliver Cromwell. The crown,the sceptre and the sword were in{Dunnottar Castle. Cromwell besieged the castle hoping to get the crown jewels. One story says Mrs.Granger,wife of the minister at Kinneff old church, managed to smuggle the crown jewels out of the castle hidden in bundles of flax. Mr.Granger hid them under a slab in front of the pulpit in the church. They stayed there safe for 8 years till the Restoration.
